title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Thunder take win over Wolves in a tough Game 4
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Jalen Williams' breakout playoff effort fuels OKC
content: Oklahoma City's Jalen Williams had the best offensive performance of his postseason career Monday night against the Timberwolves, scoring 34 points to put the Thunder one win away from the NBA Finals.

title: 'That's wonderful': Canes finally see ECF skid end
content: The Hurricanes staved off elimination and snapped a 15-game Eastern Conference finals skid with a 3-0 victory over the Panthers in Game 4.

title: Ant defends Game 4 approach after quiet night
content: After one of his quietest offensive nights this postseason, Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards defended his approach in Monday's Game 4 loss to the Thunder that put Minnesota on the brink of playoff elimination.

title: Police say Liverpool parade collision not terrorism
content: The Merseyside Police have said that the incident of a car colliding with pedestrians in Liverpool city center during Liverpool Football Club's Premier League victory parade is not being treated as terrorism.

title: Dodgers' Ohtani hits 2nd leadoff homer in 2 days
content: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani, the reigning NL MVP, hit a leadoff homer in consecutive games for the second time in his career, going deep against Cleveland's Gavin Williams for his 19th long ball of the season in his club's 7-2 win Monday.

title: Sources: Raiders' Cole now NFL's top-paid punter
content: The Raiders and All-Pro punter AJ Cole have agreed to a four-year, $15.8 million contract extension with $11 million guaranteed, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ronaldo hints at Al Nassr exit: 'Chapter is over'
content: Cristiano Ronaldo hinted at a potential departure from Al Nassr after scoring in the Saudi Pro League's season finale Monday, declaring his "chapter is over" in a social media post.

title: DeGrom fails to record a strikeout in career first
content: Rangers starter Jacob deGrom, playing in his 229th game Monday against the Blue Jays, failed to record a strikeout for the first time in his major league career.

title: üèà Ranking college football coaches as players
content: There are small-school studs and a Heisman winner. There's a national title QB and one of the best ever.

content: Our experts look at the best and worst of the season to date -- and predict which teams will rule from here on out.

title: NBA free agent rankings: Kevin Pelton's top 25 for 2025
content: Will LeBron James opt in or sign a new deal? Can Indy keep Myles Turner? We're breaking down what's next for 25 star free agents.

content: The Patriots have revamped their front office, coaching personnel and roster after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in hopes of closing the gap in the AFC East.

title: Caitlin Clark injury reaction: What's next for Indiana Fever star
content: The Fever announced Clark will miss at least two weeks with a quad strain. What's next for Clark and her team?

title: How Xabi Alonso made his rapid rise from rookie coach to Real Madrid
content: Less than three years into his career as a top-level coach, Alonso is returning to Real Madrid, the most pressurized job in football. He's earned it.

title: Two iconic races, one day: McLaren's quest to win Monaco, Indy 500
content: On Sunday, McLaren tried to win two races 4,500 miles apart: F1's Monaco GP and IndyCar's Indianapolis 500.

title: Maiden Indy 500 win completes Palou's domination of IndyCar
content: After three titles and 15 wins, √Ålex Palou felt incomplete. Now an Indy 500 winner, that's no longer the case.

title: Premier League 2024-25 awards: From best game to worst signing
content: Bill Connelly takes a look at the numbers and gives out his awards to the best and worst performers of the 2024-25 Premier League season.

title: Sources: Man Utd wait on Delap after deal agreed
content: Man United have agreed the framework of a deal for Liam Delap, sources have told ESPN, and are now waiting for him to decide on his next move.

title: Sources: Yamal nears new Bar√ßa deal until 2031
content: Lamine Yamal is close to extending his Barcelona contract until 2031 after a positive meeting between club president Joan Laporta and the player's agent, Jorge Mendes, on Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Barcelona sneak into Pot 1 for UCL draw again
content: Barcelona will be in Pot 1 of seeds for the league phase draw of the 2025-26 UEFA Champions League (UCL), and for the second successive season it's because Roma missed out on the final day.

title: Neymar out of Ancelotti's first Brazil squad
content: Carlo Ancelotti has left Neymar out from his first squad selection and has brought back Casemiro, Richarlison and Antony for the upcoming World Cup qualifiers.

title: Veterans Lozano, Ochoa return to Mexico squad
content: Winger Hirving Lozano and goalkeeper Guillermo Ochoa will return to the Mexican national team for a pair of friendly matches against Switzerland and Turkey before the Gold Cup.

title: Inzaghi denies Inter exit talks ahead of UCL final
content: Inter Milan coach Simone Inzaghi has addressed speculation regarding his future, aiming to prevent it from becoming a disruptive element as his team prepares for the Champions League final.

title: It's Good Guy vs. Bad Guy on Season 33 of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen break down what to expect from this season of TUF.

title: Waiver wire: Three hitters to add power to your infield
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and lineup tips for your fantasy roster.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: San Diego Wave starting to look formidable
content: San Diego are undefeated in six games and don't seem to be slowing down anytime soon. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Gakpo on Bayern shortlist
content: Bayern Munich have added Liverpool forward Cody Gakpo to their shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: T.N. CM Stalin dismisses Palaniswami‚Äôs remarks on his New Delhi visit
content: During a brief interaction with journalists in Chennai, Mr. Stalin, when asked about Mr. Palaniswami‚Äôs remarks over his visit to the national capital to attend the NITI Aayog meeting, said: ‚ÄúHe has nothing else to criticise this government for, so he keeps repeating this.‚Äù

title: BMRCL rolls back public toilet fee at 12 Namma Metro stations after protests in Bengaluru
content: BMRCL had handed over management of restrooms located in the unpaid areas (outside the ticketed zone) of select metro stations to Sulabh International

title: Opposition MPs conveying India's stand abroad more effectively than counterparts in Govt: Congress
content: Four Congress leaders ‚Äî Shashi Tharoor, Manish Tewari, Amar Singh and Salman Khurshid ‚Äî who were not part of the list sent by their party have been included in the delegations.

title: Tejashwi Yadav, wife Rajshree announce birth of second child
content: The baby was born in a private hospital in Kolkata where Rajshree was admitted for the last few days.

title: 2015 custodial death case: T.N. SHRC recommends ‚Çπ10 lakh compensation to deceased‚Äôs family
content: The Commission had taken suo motu cognisance of a report published in The Hindu over the custodial death of Gokulakannan and the protests that followed

title: ‚ÄòAtmosphere of fear reduced in Kashmir‚Äô: Farooq Abdullah plays golf in Pahalgam with friends
content: Farooq Abdullah urges tourists to visit Kashmir, highlighting reduced fear and natural beauty, while calling for travel advisories to be lifted

title: Jharkhand Class 10 result 2025: Girls outperform boys, Koderma district topped
content: The pass percentage of the state board's examinations in Jharkhand increased this year by 1.31 per cent compared to the previous year.

title: Bombay High Court rebukes Maharashtra Govt. for college student's arrest for post on India-Pakistan conflict
content: On May 7, 2025, the girl reposted a post on Instagram from an account called 'Reformistan', which criticised the Indian government for provoking a war against Pakistan

title: Coastal Karnataka records highest ‚Äòlarge excess‚Äô cumulative rainfall in about three months
content: Manchi Gram Panchayat in Bantwal taluk of Dakshina Kannada recorded 186.5 mm rainfall in 24 hours ending at 8.30 a.m. on May 27, which is the second highest rainfall recorded in Karnataka

title: TVK chief Vijay condemns ‚Äòpolice attack‚Äô on party women functionaries in Vyasarpadi
content: He alleged that the police obstructed and attacked women functionaries of his party at Vyasarpadi, when they were distributing aid to people affected by a fire in the area

title: Suspected Khalistani terrorist killed in blast in Amritsar
content: The man was retrieving explosive material from a vacant area; the DIG said the man was yet to be identified

title: Shrikanth Mangalwedhe, former Belagavi correpondent of The Hindu, passes away
content: As a staff correspondent, he reported widely about the language agitation and other prominent developments from Belagavi district.

title: Terrorism is Pakistan‚Äôs war strategy, India to respond accordingly: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that whenever India and Pakistan went to war, Indian armed forces defeated Pakistan in a way the neighbouring country would never forget

title: P.V. Anvar‚Äôs dissent won‚Äôt affect UDF in Nilambur bypoll, says K. Sudhakaran
content: Sudhakaran says though Anvar is upset over nomination of Aryadan Shoukath, it will not jeopardise his relationship with UDF

title: BJP expels two rebel MLAs from Karnataka for six years over ‚Äòanti-party activities‚Äô
content: Somashekar and Hebbar, who represent Yeshwanthpur and Yellapur Assembly constituencies respectively, had joined the BJP from Congress through operation Kamala in 2019.

title: Bangalore Palace grounds case: Supreme Court refers Karnataka‚Äôs plea to CJI to consider setting up a larger Bench
content: A Bench of Justices Surya Kant and Dipankar Datta referred the case to the Chief Justice to consider, on the administrative side, whether the application must be heard by a larger Bench of three judges.

title: Trees, roofing sheet fall onto railway track in Kerala‚Äôs Kozhikode; major mishap averted
content: Heavy winds lead to uprooting of trees that fell onto railway track at Areekkad in Kozhikode twice within 24 hours

title: With sports becoming a profession, youngsters should look for opportunities in the field, says former international cricketer Javagal Srinath
content: While sportspersons in India were only practising on the field, besides lifting weights in the gym, their counterparts in other countries were undergoing advanced and in-depth training programmes, he said

title: Owaisi mocks Pakistan‚Äôs Munir for gifting ‚Äòfake photo‚Äô to PM Sharif
content: Asaduddin Owaisi is part of the multi-party delegation visiting Kuwait to brief nations on India‚Äôs response to the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Karnataka rains: Early and more intense monsoon disrupts life in coastal and south interior parts of Stata
content: Four rain-related deaths were reported in various part of Karnataka between from Sunday night till Monday evening

title: What is the Bharat Forecast System: world‚Äôs highest resolution forecasting model
content: India‚Äôs new high-resolution BFS model delivers 6-km precision forecasts at the panchayat level, surpassing US, UK, and EU systems in accuracy. What is BFS?

title: Bodies of five youths drowned in river Godavari in Konaseema  retrieved
content: The eight youths, including two minors, reportedly ventured into the  river as they were not familiar with its location and depth; Rescue operation by the NDRF is still in progress.

title: AUT wants unified admission panel for self-financing and aided streams in colleges in T.N.
content: Association of University Teachers calls for fee regulations, CAS payment, and administrative reforms in aided colleges

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh approves AMCA execution model through industry partnership
content: The first prototype of AMCA is expected to roll out by 2028-29 and production is expected to begin from 2032-33 with induction targeted in 2034, as per officials

title: In Iran, Pakistan PM expresses willingness to hold peace talks with India to ‚Äòresolve all issues‚Äô
content: "We want to resolve all disputes, including the Kashmir issue and the water issue, through negotiations and are also ready to talk to our neighbour on trade and counter-terrorism,‚Äù he said.

title: PM Modi holds roadshow in Gandhinagar
content: People gathered in large numbers, waving the tricolour along the route of PM Modi‚Äôs roadshow in Gandhinagar.

title: IMD issues red alert for three Kerala districts as low-pressure system strengthens monsoon winds
content: Red alert for three districts ‚Äì Kannur, Wayanad and Kozhikode ‚Äì and orange alert for remaining districts except Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam and Alappuzha where yellow alert has been sounded

title: Odisha to patent terminologies associated with Puri Jagannath temple
content: The move to patent temple-related terms has generated considerable public interest due to controversy around use of ‚ÄòDham‚Äô for West Bengal government-built temple at Digha

title: From bear rescue centres to education of disadvantaged children, here are four volunteering opportunities around Bengaluru
content: If you find time hanging on your hands, try something new and adventurous by signing up as a volunteer. PS: It will look good on your CV as well

title: Actor Unni Mukundan booked for allegedly assaulting manager
content: Alleged assault occurred over Unni Mukundan‚Äôs manager‚Äôs positive review of a recent Malayalam film in which the lead character is played by another actor, according to FIR

title: 2026 Assembly polls will be a Gogoi versus Saikia contest, says Assam BJP chief
content: The regional Assam Jatiya Parishad hopes the Jorhat MP‚Äôs elevation as State Congress president will give the United Opposition Forum renewed momentum

title: Karnataka rains: Heavy downpour hits Hassan district, landslips on Shiradi Ghat
content: Leader of Opposition in Legislative Assembly R. Ashok will be visiting rain-hit areas of Hassan district

title: May-Hem in Mumbai: How earliest ever monsoon arrival cought authorities off guard
content: Mumbai experienced its earliest monsoon onset ever recorded, breaking a century-old rainfall record for May with 295mm. The city received very heavy rainfall, with Colaba recording 144.3 mm and Santacruz 74.3 mm. The intense showers exposed the city's unpreparedness, leading to waterlogging in new areas, disruption of train and flight services, and incidents of structural damage.

title: Tej Pratap breaks silence after family ouster, congratulates Tejashwi on newborn son
content: Tej Pratap Yadav congratulated his brother Tejashwi on the birth of his second child, a son, after being expelled from the RJD by his father, Lalu Prasad Yadav, for revealing a long-term relationship and citing moral values. Tejashwi supported his father's decision, emphasizing personal freedom while upholding the party's dedication to the people of Bihar.

title: 'Your visa may be revoked if ...': US embassy warns Indian, international students
content: The U.S. government has cautioned international students that their visas could be revoked for non-compliance, such as skipping classes or dropping out without notifying their institutions. This action could also jeopardize their future eligibility for U.S. visas. This warning follows reports of over 4,700 international students having their study permissions revoked this spring, potentially due to stricter immigration enforcement.

title: Fan goes wild imitating cheerleaders during IPL match, police steps in
content: During an IPL 2025 match between CSK and RR, a fan's spirited imitation of cheerleaders led to a brief interruption by security. On the field, Vaibhav Suryavanshi's explosive 57 guided Rajasthan to a six-wicket victory, chasing down 188 with ease. Despite the win and notable performances from both sides, both teams failed to qualify for the knockouts.

title: Rolex, Thar, plots: Dismissed cop Amandeep Kaur's lavish life under scanner
content: Amandeep Kaur, a Punjab Police head constable known as 'Instagram Queen,' was arrested for possessing assets disproportionate to her income. Authorities froze her properties worth ‚Çπ1.35 crore, including a house, plot, Thar, and luxury items. Previously dismissed for a heroin possession, she violated social media rules by posting reels in uniform.

title: Trump to Apple: Okay, you go to India but you're not going to sell in America without ...
content: President Trump is pushing Apple to manufacture iPhones in the United States, threatening a 25% tariff on imported products if they continue production in India. Trump expressed his desire for Apple to prioritize domestic manufacturing, even though India has offered tariff-free deals.

title: Bold statement! 'Shreyas Iyer felt underappreciated at KKR'
content: Under Shreyas Iyer's leadership, Punjab Kings have secured a Qualifier 1 spot in the 2025 IPL season, showcasing a remarkable turnaround. Iyer's captaincy has instilled stability and direction, earning praise from experts like Robin Uthappa. His inclusive leadership style, as highlighted by teammate Shashank Singh, has fostered a positive team environment, fueling their historic campaign.

title: 'No one helped us': Family of 7 suicide in Panchkula leaves neighbourhood in shock
content: In a tragic incident in Panchkula, Praveen Mittal and his family of six were found dead in their car, victims of suspected suicide due to overwhelming financial debts. Praveen, visibly distraught, confessed to their dire situation before collapsing, leaving the community in shock.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' college students: World you're entering ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: 'Haven't done anything yet and Pakistan is already sweating': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a stern warning to Pakistan, highlighting India's actions regarding the Indus Water Treaty and its impact. He criticized the neglect of dam maintenance in Jammu and Kashmir under the treaty, asserting India's right to utilize its water resources effectively. Modi emphasized a firm stance against terrorism, advocating a strong response to cross-border attacks.

title: 'Trump app scam': Over 200 in Karnataka fall prey to investment fraud
content: A fraudulent app named 'Trump Hotel Rental,' featuring AI-generated content of the former US President, has reportedly defrauded over 200 investors in Karnataka of nearly Rs 2 crore. The scammers lured victims with promises of high returns on investments, but the earnings displayed on the app were fictitious. Police investigations are underway across multiple districts following numerous complaints.

title: BSE Sensex down over 1,000 points: Top reasons markets are falling today
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went below 24,750, BSE Sensex was trading below 81,300.

title: Khan Sir's 'Shaadi' announcement to students: 'Isi Dauraan Pak aur Bharat...'
content: Khan Sir, the popular educator, surprised his students by announcing his marriage. He revealed that the wedding was a private affair due to India-Pakistan tensions and "Operation Sindoor." The conflict led him to opt for a simple ceremony. He announced a reception in Patna on June 2 and a special banquet for his students on June 6.

title: Instamart sheds Swiggy branding in bid for standalone identity
content: Instamart, a quick commerce platform, is distancing itself from the Swiggy branding to establish its own independent identity, following a similar move by Zomato. This strategic shift reflects Instamart's growth beyond groceries and food delivery, aiming to become a standalone brand with its own loyal user base. The new logo incorporates Swiggy's 'S-Pin' as a nod to its origins.

title: Explosion rocks chemical plant in China; over 230 firefighters deployed
content: A significant explosion struck Gaomi Youdao Chemical Co. in Weifang, Shandong province, China, on Tuesday, prompting a large-scale emergency response. The blast, which occurred around noon local time, released dark smoke visible from the facility, a producer of pesticides and medical chemicals.

title: Akshay Kumar breaks silence on Paresh Rawal leaving 'Hera Pheri 3
content: Following Paresh Rawal's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3' and the subsequent lawsuit filed by Akshay Kumar's production house, Akshay addressed the issue at a 'Housefull 5' trailer launch. He defended Rawal against negative comments, emphasizing their long-standing friendship and professional respect. Kumar acknowledged the seriousness of the legal matter, stating it would be handled by the courts.

title: Video | 'Housefull 5' trailer out: Film promises laugh riot with suspense
content: The 'Housefull 5' trailer unveils a murder mystery aboard a cruise liner, where Akshay, Abhishek, and Riteish vie for an inheritance. After a night of revelry, they're accused of murder, prompting investigators Sanjay Dutt and Jackie Shroff to unravel the truth.

title: Watch: Nasa astronaut captures Northern Lights aurora over North America
content: Astronaut Nichole Ayers, aboard the International Space Station, captured a stunning display of the Northern Lights over North America. While photographing severe storms, Ayers unexpectedly witnessed the vibrant green and purple aurora, triggered by heightened geomagnetic activity. The NOAA reported a Kp index of 6, enhancing visibility from space and Earth.

title: BCCI to honour Indian Armed forces during IPL 2025 closing ceremony
content: The BCCI will dedicate the IPL 2025 closing ceremony to India's armed forces, honouring their valour during Operation Sindoor. Senior armed forces officials have been invited, and stands will be dedicated to them during the match. The ceremony will feature patriotic songs and a possible performance by military bands, creating a solemn tribute to the nation's heroes.

title: 'Turned into criminal': HC raps Maha govt for arresting student over Op Sindoor post
content: The Bombay high court rebuked the Maharashtra government for its extreme response in arresting a 19-year-old student over a social media post about Operation Sindoor. The court questioned why the student was treated as a criminal after she apologized, emphasizing the importance of reform over punishment.

title: It's not over yet! IMD warns of rain, storms in Delhi on May 30 & 31
content: Delhi is bracing for a wet and stormy end to May, with the India Meteorological Department forecasting rain, thunderstorms, and gusty winds up to 60 kmph. These conditions are expected to keep temperatures below normal, contrasting sharply with last year's heatwave. Delhi has experienced its wettest May ever, with 186.

title: 'Influenced contracts in BMC': What EOW said after questioning Dino Morea river scam
content: Actor Dino Morea and his brother Santino were questioned by the Economic Offences Wing for eight hours regarding the Mithi river desilting scam. Santino's company shares an address with Vodar India LLP, a company under investigation. Authorities are investigating potential connections between Dino Morea, Ketan Kadam (an arrested suspect), and possible influence on BMC contracts.

title: Sub-7 day fixed deposits soon? Here‚Äôs what RBI has asked banks to consider
content: The Reserve Bank of India is exploring the possibility of allowing banks to offer fixed deposits with tenures shorter than seven days, seeking feedback from banks by the end of the month. This move aims to boost deposit attractiveness and liquidity amid declining deposit growth.

title: Karnataka BJP expels MLAs Somashekar, Hebbar for 6 years over 'anti-party' activities
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has expelled two of its Karnataka MLAs, S T Somashekar and A Shivaram Hebbar, for six years due to alleged anti-party activities. State president B Y Vijayendra announced the decision after deliberations by the BJP high command. The expulsion letters cite repeated violations of party discipline and immediate removal from primary membership and party positions.

title: Woman trespasses into Aditya Roy Kapur's home in Mumbai, complaint filed against her
content: A woman trespassed into Aditya Roy Kapur's Mumbai residence while he was away filming. Identifying herself as Gazala Jhakaria Siddique from Dubai, she claimed to have brought gifts for the actor. Kapur, upon returning, didn't recognize her and alerted his manager, who then contacted the police.

title: Can Kuldeep Yadav be India's trump card in England?
content: The last time England's "Bazballers" faced Kuldeep Yadav, they found it tough to pick his length, variations, and to some extent, loop as well. He took 19 wickets in four Test matches on a "true wicket," not a rank-turner, and turned the tide towards India after they were trailing 0-1 in the five-match series. Although Kuldeep won't have fond memories of England, where he had a forgettable experience at Lord's in 2018, at 30, with more maturity and improved skillsets, he can be India's trump card.

title: Blast in Amritsar village near Pak border kills suspected Babbar Khalsa member
content: A man died in an explosion near Naushera village in Amritsar, close to the Pakistan border. Police suspect the blast was caused by mishandling an explosive device. The deceased is believed to be a member of Babbar Khalsa, a banned terror group with suspected ties to Pakistan‚Äôs ISI, who came to retrieve an explosive consignment.

title: 'We haven't achieved anything': Ponting says PBKS can‚Äôt celebrate yet
content: Despite Punjab Kings securing a top-two IPL 2025 playoff spot with a victory over Mumbai Indians, coach Ricky Ponting emphasises that the team's journey is far from over. He acknowledges the team's balance and leadership under Shreyas Iyer, but stresses the importance of maintaining focus and finishing the job in the upcoming Qualifier 1.

title: India‚Äôs first! Tata-Airbus to make 'best-selling' H125 chopper in India
content: Airbus and Tata Advanced Systems will establish an H125 helicopter Final Assembly Line in Kolar, Karnataka, marking India's first private-sector helicopter assembly. The facility aims to produce 10 helicopters annually, expanding based on a projected regional demand of 500 light helicopters over two decades.

title: Virender Sehwag takes a cheeky jibe at Rohit Sharma
content: Virender Sehwag playfully commented on Rohit Sharma's struggles in the IPL powerplay, noting that a slower start might help him stay at the crease longer, given his tendency to get out early. Rohit's recent form includes only three scores above 50 in 13 innings, with nine dismissals during the powerplay.

title: Kerala has most number of active Covid cases in India
content: Kerala is currently experiencing a surge in Covid-19 cases, reporting the highest number of active cases in the country with 430, a significant jump from 95 earlier in May. While most patients experience mild symptoms like fatigue and cough and recover without hospitalization, two deaths have been recorded this month. The elderly and those with comorbidities remain particularly vulnerable.

title: JAC 10th result 2025 declared: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The JAC Class 10th Result 2025 has been officially declared today, May 27, with a pass percentage of 91.71%, surpassing last year‚Äôs performance. Over 4.33 lakh students appeared for the exams held between February and March. Students can check their results via the official JAC websites, DigiLocker, or SMS for quick and easy access.

title: Family of 7 found dead in car: Suicide pact suspected, debt angle under probe
content: In a distressing incident, a family of seven from Dehradun was found dead in a car in Panchkula, suspected to be a suicide pact. Preliminary investigations suggest heavy debt drove the family, including Praveen Mittal, his parents, wife, and three children, to take this extreme step.

title: Shreyas Iyer's boundary rope chat with Akash Ambani goes viral
content: Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in the IPL 2025 after defeating Mumbai Indians by seven wickets, marking their first playoff appearance in 11 years. Priyansh Arya's composed innings and Josh Inglis' explosive half-century propelled Punjab to victory. A viral moment occurred when Mumbai owner Akash Ambani was seen in conversation with Punjab captain Shreyas Iyer during the match.

title: Atmanirbhar Bharat push: AMCA plan gets green light; all you need to know
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has approved the AMCA Programme Execution Model, aiming to boost indigenous defence capabilities. The Aeronautical Development Agency will collaborate with industry partners to develop the AMCA prototype, a fifth-generation stealth fighter jet. While the first two squadrons will use GE-F414 engines, the next five will feature 110 kilonewton engines, with production expected by 2035.

title: IPL match today, LSG vs RCB: All you need to know
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru aims for a top-two finish for the first time since 2016 as they face Lucknow Super Giants in their final league game. RCB needs a win to secure second place, while LSG, despite inconsistency, remains a dangerous opponent with key players returning. The pitch favors spinners and pace variations, with teams preferring to chase.

title: How big is universe? Discover what scientists have uncovered beyond Pluto
content: The universe's vastness challenges human comprehension. It contains trillions of galaxies and countless stars. Pluto's distance highlights cosmic scales. The observable universe spans 93 billion light-years. Dark energy fuels continuous expansion. Voyager 1 marks a tiny step in space exploration. Our quest for knowledge redefines our place in the cosmos. Mankind is at the threshold of discoveries.

title: 'Heard bumps as he drove over people': Eyewitnesses recount Liverpool horror
content: During Liverpool's Premier League victory parade, a car drove into the crowd, injuring nearly 50 people, with 27 hospitalized. Eyewitnesses described the horrifying scene as the car plowed through fans, leaving people injured on the roadside. The driver, a 53-year-old man, was arrested, and authorities believe he acted alone, not considering it terrorism.

title: ‚ÄòBhool Chuk Maaf‚Äô box office: Film crosses Rs 30 crore mark
content: Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf,' a blend of comedy, drama, and time loop elements, has captivated audiences. The film, overcoming release hurdles, earned Rs 7 crore on its opening day and witnessed substantial growth over the weekend, crossing Rs. 30 crore in India after a 4-day run. Despite competition, the movie is maintaining a steady pace at the box office.

title: 'Doing it for fun': Woman's Uber driver turns out to be her office team lead
content: In Bengaluru, a woman's Uber ride took an unexpected turn when she discovered her driver was none other than her team lead from work. He revealed that he drives in his spare time as a recreational activity to alleviate boredom. This unusual incident has sparked amusement and skepticism online, highlighting the unique aspects of Bengaluru's professional culture.

title: US Lawmaker Was Denied Access To Man Wrongly Deported To El Salvador
content: US authorities admit that Abrego Garcia was deported to an El Salvadoran prison due to an error, but have refused to comply with court orders to return him to the US.

title: Behind The Political Tension Fuelling Unrest In Bangladesh
content: Bangladesh's interim government, led by Nobel peace laureate Muhammad Yunus, faces mounting discontent among citizens and discord among political parties as election delays and reform deadlock continues.

title: Australian Woman 'Loved' Lunch Guests She Is Accused Of Killing: Court
content: Erin Patterson, 50, is charged with murdering the parents and aunt of her estranged husband in 2023 by serving them a beef Wellington laced with lethal "death cap" mushrooms.

title: South Korea's Presidential Candidate Lee Jae-myung Leads In Opinion Polls
content: South Korea's liberal frontrunner for president Lee Jae-myung was leading his main conservative rival Kim Moon-soo by more than 10 percentage points in an opinion poll issued on Tuesday, though the race had tightened a week ahead of the election.

title: US Man Gets 210 Years In Jail For Sexually Abusing Children At His Orphanage
content: At least six men, who were between 9 and 13 years of age when they resided at the St. Joseph's Home for Boys between 2005 and 2010, testified against their abuser.

title: No Signs Of Reconciliation Between King Charles And Prince Harry: Experts
content: British royal expert Hilary Fordwich said the Duke of Sussex has destroyed the trust between him and the royal family by publicly complaining about issues like his security, which is a constitutional matter.

title: Did Jyoti Malhotra Know Her Pak Friends Were ISI? What Cops Found On Laptop
content: Haryana YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra knew that the Pakistani officials she was in touch with worked with Inter-Services Intelligence, Pakistan's notorious spy agency, but she had no fear

title: Global Warming Could Be Making Cancer In Women More Common And Deadly: Study
content: Global warming could be making cancer in women more common and deadly, according to a study conducted in the Middle East and North Africa.

title: US Woman Beats Man With Bat, Abandons Him On Street To Be Hit By Cars
content: A Louisiana woman has been charged with manslaughter after she allegedly beat a man with a baseball bat and abandoned him on the road where he was run over by two cars, police said.

title: Korean Pear Juice, IV Drips: Do These Trendy Hangover Cures Actually Work
content: Hangovers aren't just something to complain about over a greasy breakfast - they're big business. The global market for hangover cures is now valued at US$2.29 billion (A$3.53 billion) and projected to reach US$6.71 billion (A$10.33 billion) by 2032.

title: 10 Indians Among Over 100 Climbers Honored For Summiting Mount Everest
content: Ten Indian climbers are among over 100 mountaineers honored in Nepal on Tuesday to commemorate the first successful ascent of Mount Everest by Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay.

title: 2 Indian-Origin Singaporeans Charged With Organizing Illegal Assemblies
content: Two Indian-origin Singaporeans were charged on Tuesday for organising illegal public assemblies of foreign workers demanding payments owed to one of them.

title: Instamart Drops Parent 'Swiggy' Name To Build Standalone Brand Identity
content: Quick commerce platform Instamart has dropped parent Swiggy from its name, in a strategic move aimed at carving a standalone brand identity.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Akash System, AI Drones, And Why India Can't 'Outsource' Security
content: A nation that lacks the capacity to manufacture its own armaments finds itself vulnerable to the whims of key defence exporting countries.

title: All About Bharat-Bhutan Mystic Mountain Tour: A 14-Day Journey By IRCTC
content: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) is launching an exclusive 14-day Bharat-Bhutan Mystic Mountain Tour. It will allow visitors to explore the natural beauty and rich culture of Northeast India and the neighbouring country.

title: Fluent In English, She Abruptly Stopped Speaking The Language. Here's Why
content: A Chinese woman, who was fluent in English, inexplicably lost her ability to speak the language after a cerebral haemorrhage.

title: "People With Co-Morbidities Must Wear Masks": Siddaramaiah As Covid Cases Rise
content: As Karnataka recorded 80 COVID-19 cases, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said on Tuesday that the elderly and people with co-morbidities must wear masks as a precautionary measure.

title: How This 'Run It Straight' Challenge Turned Deadly: What To Know
content: A 19-year-old boy from New Zealand died after taking part in a rugby-inspired social media craze called the "Run It Straight" challenge. He died after sustaining a severe head injury.

title: "Macron Got Man-Handled": Internet Trolls French President Over Viral Video
content: A video of French President Emmanuel Macron's wife, Brigitte, allegedly shoving his face away has become the latest content for meme creators.

content: Indian equities crashed this morning after rallying for two sessions, with investors turning cautious ahead of the release of key data on the country's economic performance.

Otherwise, my bullet is there for you (sukh chain ki zindagi jio, roti khao. Varna meri goli to hai hee),‚Äù the Prime Minister asserted in the direct message to those across the border

title: Mumbai breaks record, receives highest rainfall in May

title: Norway Chess: Magnus Carlsen defeats D Gukesh in opening round
content: Magnus Carlsen defeated D Gukesh in the Norway Chess tournament, showcasing his endgame skills. Hikaru Nakamura also secured a win against Fabiano Caruana. Arjun Erigaisi triumphed over Wei Yi in an Armageddon game after a draw. In the women's category, Koneru Humpy defeated R. Vaishali in an all-Indian match.

title: Monsoon intensifies across India; IMD issues multiple warnings
content: Delhi is bracing for rain, thunderstorms, and strong winds, with a yellow alert issued for potential disruptions. Mumbai experiences relief with light rainfall and anticipates continued showers. Coastal Karnataka faces a red alert with forecasts of extremely heavy rainfall, while Kerala is under alert for heavy rains, thunderstorms, and high winds, prompting safety measures and coastal warnings.

title: Blue Islands aircraft makes emergency landing due to 'technical issue'
content: A Blue Islands aircraft, en route from Birmingham to Jersey, executed an emergency landing shortly after takeoff due to a technical issue affecting one of its engines. The crew followed standard procedures, shutting down the engine preventively after a cockpit alert. Passengers recounted a frightening experience, praising the pilot's handling of the situation, while the AAIB decided against further investigation.

title: Maldives extends ‚Äòfirm support‚Äô to India in fight against terrorism

title: Centre‚Äôs reform nudge to States resulting in less land wastage, increased digitisation
content: According to data shared by the Finance Ministry, 22 states have carried out reforms in building bye laws for industrial and commercial plots. Of these, 18 States have reduced land wastage in factory plots due to outdated setbacks and parking regulations to less than 30%

title: Two-stop experiment doesn't fix F1's Monaco procession problem
